title: Koinvote
author: Koinvote
content: check out koinvote.comIt’s a platform that allows you to endorse your candidate with Bitcoin signatures.Currently, Harris has received 454.07774504 BTC in endorsements, significantly surpassing Trump’s 4.77287924 BTC.At the same time, Bitcoin’s price has climbed to 73,000 USD, bringing the total endorsement amount on the platform to 33.5 million USD.All addresses, plaintext messages, and signatures involved in endorsements are public and fully verifiable.The more Bitcoin that participates, the more representative the endorsements become.

comments.author: Russlenat
comments.body: If we convert that to Bitcoin right now, that’s around $32 million, but can we trust that website?I mean, there are reliable sites that track the funds raised for both candidates, but they only show USD amounts, no crypto.https://www.fec.gov/https://www.opensecrets.org/

comments.author: Luzin
comments.body: This is dubious, I am trying to trace this address. Has Kemala been storing BTC since 2017? There is a balance of 454,039 since then. After that there were some BTC additions but they were so small it looked like a faucet. I am suspicious, especially since Kemala Haris did not give an official statement. The perception of the amount of Bitcoin received also does not describe many supporters. I think the current condition is just a provocation to get more supporters for Kemala.  IMO

You can easily verify them using wallet software like Electrum.That is not the funds they raised, but rather Bitcoin holders expressing their political intentions.
